alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued October 20 at 9:57AM PDT until October 20 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility of a quarter of a mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Central Douglas County and Eastern Douglas County Foothills, including Interstate 5 from near Roseburg northward and also Highway 38 and Highway 138 west of Glide. It also includes the Coos and Curry County Coasts, including most sections of Highway 101 from Port Orford northward and also from Gold Beach southward. * WHEN...Now until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dense fog continues, so will extend this advisory out by an hour. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow for plenty of room between you and other vehicles. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are * Use low beams. High beams reflect back thick fog, making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Be prepared. Keep your headlights clean. That way, you`re ready for low-visibility conditions * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Coast
